summary.name: Champion Petfoods (Canada)
summary.description: This [commodity biography](https://sites.google.com/site/mydogsdinnersourcemap/home) follows several Canadian ingredients to the Champion Petfoods factory in Morinville, Alberta, where the end product is then exported to 50 countries globally. It shows the Canadian farms and factories where ingredients come from, though some of these places have specific information, while others have minimal details. It also shows the countries which import Champion Petfoods’ products.  The company ships to hundreds of cities throughout several countries, but the map shows only one entry for each country. On the company’s website each distributor per international country is listed, and this is the address used for each country.

overview.name: Champion Petfoods
overview.description: Fresh Regional Ingredients mirror Mother Nature, supplying nutrients in their freshest, most natural and nourishing form.

overview.name: Tiaan Giim International Trade Co., Ltd
Orijen Pet Foods Four Importers t/a
La Ticinese Farmaceutici s.n.c. di Gatti Daniele & C.
Eggs
overview.description:
On the Champion Petfood website and labels, eggs are listed as coming from Alberta prairie farms and B.C.'s Fraser Valley, and are delivered fresh, whole, and never frozen.  Right below this statement is a video of the factory supplier of the eggs, Vanderpol Egg Products, which is in Abbotsford, BC.  In the video Henry Meerstra states that the eggs they use for Champion Petfoods are broken and pasteurized immediately on a Monday, lab certified on Wednesday, and delivered on Thursday.  Some contradictory information here to say the least.

Orijen. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/fresh_regional/eggs

location.address: 3911 Mount Lehman Road, Abbotsford, BC V4X 1Y6, Canada

overview.name: Duck
overview.description:
King Cole Ducks supply cage-free duck to Champion Petfoods.  Their head office is in Aurora, Ontario, though their farms are throughout the York region.  The company claims to be responsible farmers, using 100% of the duck; tongues and feet are shipped to Asian markets, neck and bones are sold to pet food companies (such as Champion Petfoods), and feathers are separated and processed into bedding and clothing.

Champion Petfoods. (2013). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.acana.com/about-acana/fresh-regional-ingredients/fresh-local-poultry/

King Cole Ducks Ltd. (2012). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.kingcoleducks.com/home.html

overview.name: Turkey
overview.description:
Free-run turkey supplied to Champion Petfoods comes from Pine Park Farms in Alberta.  However, I cannot find information about a turkey farm called Pine Park in Alberta from doing an internet search.

Champion Petfoods. (2013). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.acana.com/about-acana/fresh-regional-ingredients/fresh-local-poultry/

overview.name: Chicken
overview.description:
Champion Petfoods states that their Cobb chicken is from Meko Farms, though I can't find any information about that name or place.  The farm is apparently somewhere in Alberta and raises their chicken in a free-run environment and free of antibiotics and hormones.  On the Champion Petfoods website they have a video showing Hallmark Poultry in Vancouver as the processing plant.  Perhaps the chicken are raised in Alberta, processed in Vancouver, and then manufactured into pet food back in Alberta?

Champion Petfoods. (2013). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.acana.com/about-acana/fresh-regional-ingredients/fresh-local-poultry/

Orijen. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/fresh_regional/chicken

location.address: 1756 Pandora Street, Vancouver, BC V5L 1L8, Canada

overview.name: Lamb
overview.description:
Champion Petfoods' lamb comes from Tangle Ridge Ranch in Thorsby, Alberta.  The ranch does not use pesticides, chemical fertilizers and believes in maintaining a natural and balanced eco-system.  

Tangle Ridge Ranch. (2009). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://tangleridgeranch.ca/

Orijen. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/fresh_regional/lamb

overview.name: Bison
overview.description:
Acana states that their bison comes from Trochu, Alberta and their website says that the bison comes from 'Canadian Rangelands.'  The Canadian Rangelands website is a third party business which retails bison and buys from local ranches.  According to the Canadian Bison Producers Membership, the only bison producer in Trochu is Coulee Ridge Bison.  

The Orijen website has a link to a video of their bison supplier; Pemmican Hill Ranch in Thorsby, Alberta.  On the map I have indicated this location.

Possibly Champion Petfoods two brands, Orijen and Acana get their bison from different suppliers?



Bison Producers of Alberta. (2012). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.canadianbison.ca/producer/Members_Area/documents/ABMay15.pdf

Champion Petfoods. (2013). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.acana.com/about-acana/fresh-regional-ingredients/fresh-local-meats/

Orijen. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/fresh_regional/bison

overview.name: Saltwater Fish
overview.description:
Champion Petfoods sources their saltwater fish such as Pacific salmon, flounder, and herring from Keltic Seafoods in Port Hardy, BC.  The fish are wild-caught during the fishing season and farmed during the off-season.  According to the district of Port Hardy, "byproducts from the aquaculture industry are utilized by companies like Keltic Seafoods for creating pet foods, garden fertilizers, fish oil, fish meal and bait."  Champion Petfoods states that their fish is packed on ice and delivered in a single day.


District of Port Hardy. (2012). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://porthardy.ca/invest/atlantic-farmed-salmon

Keltic Seafoods Ltd. (2013). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/fresh_regional/salt_water_fish

Orijen. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/fresh_regional/salt_water_fish

location.address: 8625 Glenview Road, Port Hardy, BC V0N 2P0, Canada

overview.name: Champion Petfoods Factory
overview.description:
All products are made within this "award-winning factory" in Morinville, Alberta.  What makes Champion Petfoods different from other pet food brands is that they source their ingredients from within Canada and manufacture their products in one local factory.

Champion Petfoods. (2013). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.championpetfoods.com/faq/#about

location.address: Unnamed Road, Lac la Biche, AB T0A 2C0, Canada

overview.name: Beef
overview.description:
Champion Petfoods' angus beef comes from family-owned Spring Creek Ranch in Vegreville, Alberta.  The ranch claims not to use hormones, steroids, antibiotics, or any additives.  The ranch has a biorefinery which uses cattle manure to generate power to over 1000 homes.

Orijen. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/fresh_regional/beef

Spring Creek Ranch. (2011). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://springcreek.ca/

overview.name: Freshwater Fish
overview.description:
Champion Petfoods goes through Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation for their wild-caught freshwater fish such as walleye, pike, Steelhead trout, and Lake whitefish.  Freshwater Fish Marketing Corp. buys, processes and markets the fish.  They buy from over 2,000 fishers from various lakes in northern Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba and the Northwest Territories.  Their headquarters is in Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Champion Petfoods states their fish is delivered fresh each day and never frozen.

Freshwater Fish. (2010). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.freshwaterfish.com/

Orijen. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/fresh_regional/fish

location.address: Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation, 132 MAIN, Riverton, MB R0C 2R0, Canada

overview.name: Apple, Pear & Apricot
overview.description:
Red Delicious apples, Bartlett pears, and Tilton apricots come from the Okanagan and Similkameen valleys.  No particular farms are mentioned on the Champion Petfoods website or labels.

Champion Freeze Dry. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://freezedry.orijen.ca/sites/default/files/orijen-freeze-dry.pdf

Champion Petfoods. (2013). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.acana.com/about-acana/fresh-regional-ingredients/fresh-whole-fruits-vegetables/

location.address: Unnamed Road, Okanagan-Similkameen H, BC V0H, Canada

overview.name: Carrot
overview.description:
Sunfresh Farms is a company owned by various Alberta farmers.  Produce arrives from several local farms in Alberta to their warehouse/supplier in Edmonton.  Champion Petfoods specifically states that their carrot is supplied by Sunfresh Farms, though other vegetables may be as well.

Champion Petfoods. (2013). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.acana.com/about-acana/fresh-regional-ingredients/fresh-whole-fruits-vegetables/

Sunfresh Farms. (2013). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.sunfreshfarms.ca/news/

location.address: 176 Street Northwest, Edmonton, AB T5S, Canada

overview.name: Boar
overview.description:
Hog Wild Specialties of Mayerthorpe, Alberta supply Champion Petfoods with fresh, wild boar.

Hog Wild Specialties. (2012). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://www.hogwild.ab.ca/

Orijen. (n.d.) Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/fresh_regional/boar

Russet potatoes are supplied from southern Manitoba.  No other information regarding farms is listed on Champion Petfoods website or labels.

Orijen. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/about_orijen/regional

Sun-cured alfalfa comes from southern Alberta.  No particular farms or suppliers are listed on the company website or labels.

Orijen. (n.d.). Retrieved March 16, 2013 from http://orijen.ca/about_orijen/regional
